docs.title: Leonis
docs.text:
Leonis is a opensource and modern biolink page, the page can be built by a CLI.

  • Make your Leonis

    How to configure your Leonis, and how to build it.

    View

  • Backend

    A simple documentation about the backend of Leonis.

    View

docs.title: Backend
docs.text: The backend of Leonis is a simple API for the Discord Integration of Leonis.

docs.title: Features
docs.text: The backend of Leonis have a specific feature: get the name, the avatar and the status of a Discord user.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
Node Package Manager

The builder is available on npmjs.com named @leonis/builder.

For configure your Leonis, you need to have installed:

  • Node JS

    You need to install NodeJS.

    Install

  • Builder

    You need to install the Leonis Builder.

    npm install -g @leonis/builder

docs.title: Configure
docs.text: For configure your Leonis, you need to create a config.yml or any other file with the same extension.

docs.title: Required fields
docs.text:
A leonis config file must have the following fields:

  • name: Your username
  • description: A little description about you
  • background: The background image of your page (For the path, see here)

docs.title: File paths
docs.text:
For multiple fields, you have to specify the path of the file. To specify the path of the file, you need to make a folder named resources. And inside the folder, you need to put the files.

After, in the field, you need to put the name of the file.

docs.title: Effects
docs.text:
You can add effects to your page. There are effects for the background, your name, and your description.

Note

All the fields are optional.

In the config file, this is the syntax: 

effects:
  background:
  name:
  description:

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
The effects for the background are:

  • blurred: The background is blurred.

    For this effect, you can specify the intensity of the blur.

    effects: 
  background: blurred
background_blur: 5px

    Zoom

  • old_tv: The background is like an old TV.

    Zoom

  • night_time: The background is darken.

    Zoom

docs.title: Name
docs.text:
The effects for the name are:

  • rainbow: The name is like a rainbow.

    Zoom

  • flash: The name is flashing.

    Zoom

docs.title: Description
docs.text:
The effects for the description are:

  • typewriter: The description is like a typewriter.

    Zoom

docs.title: Links
docs.text:
You can add links to your page. There are links for your social media and your projects.

In the config file, this is the syntax: 

links:
    - icon: Icon
      url: Link
      color: Color

docs.title: Icon
docs.text: The icon is the icon of the link. Icons are from Simple Icons.

docs.title: URL
docs.text: This is the URL of the project or the social media.

docs.title: Color
docs.text:
For the style, we add a colored shadow to the icon.

This is the color of the shadow.

docs.title: Profile
docs.text:
This is multiple things related to your profile.

For, the profile, this is the syntax: 

profile:
  field: Value

docs.title: Blur
docs.text:
This is the blur of the container of the profile.

Blur is expressed in pixels. 

profile:
  blur: 5px

docs.title: Opacity
docs.text:
This is the opacity of the container of the profile.

Opacity is expressed in percentage. 

profile:
  opacity: 20

docs.title: Avatar
docs.text:
File path

For the path, see here.

This is the avatar of the profile.

profile:
  avatar: avatar.png

docs.title: Layout
docs.text:
This is the layout for your username, description and avatar.

The layout can be center, left or right. 

profile:
  layout: center

docs.title: Discord
docs.text:
This is your Discord ID, for show your Discord Status. 

profile:
  discord: "902671568856047636"

docs.title: Geolocation
docs.text:
This is your geolocation, if you want to show it. 

profile:
  geolocation:
    latitude: 48.569045
    longitude: 7.6796789

docs.title: Music
docs.text:
File path

For the path, see here.

This is the music for your page. The music add a background music to your page.

This feature add a message when a person load your page before start the music.

For the music, this is the syntax: 

music: music.mp3

docs.title: Backend
docs.text:
This is the backend for get Discord Status. For the backend, this is the syntax: 

backend: https://leonis.oriondev.fr

docs.title: Build
docs.text:
For build your Leonis, you need to run the following command: 

leonis

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
The builder have two options:

  • --input: The path of the config file.
  • --output: The path of the output folder.
